text: Hypoiodite is an ion. Its chemical formula is IO-. It is very unstable. It easily disproportionates to iodide and iodate. It is made by reacting iodine with a base. The iodine is in its +1 oxidation state. It is the salt of hypoiodous acid. ==Related pages== *Iodine monochloride *Iodine trifluoride Category:Iodine compounds Category:Oxyanions
title: Hypoiodite
